intro: Heliophytum pterocarpum, commonly known as the golden trumpet tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves and produces pods that contain seeds, typical of many leguminous species. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a hardy and ornamental plant in suitable climates. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to both ecological and horticultural settings.
